main_definition: The fingers are the five long, slender extensions of a person's hand, used primarily for grasping and manipulating objects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A body part consisting of any one of the five digits on each hand or foot in humans, with exception to the thumb.
meanings_and_examples.example: She gently touched his finger to check if he was alright.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used metaphorically to indicate a small amount or portion of something, often referring to evidence or proof.
meanings_and_examples.example: He had only one finger on the map to guide him through the wilderness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit used in measuring length, typically equivalent to 1/3 inch (8.4 mm).
meanings_and_examples.example: The width of a standard sheet of paper is approximately one finger's thickness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used informally to refer to the act of pointing out or indicating something, typically using a finger.
meanings_and_examples.example: He couldn't help but point his finger at her mistake during the meeting.
